This is a casual place with eccentric décor, inspired by their boutique. Kamoli is a unique place in San Juan where you can dine and buy clothes.

Name: Levi's Bar & Grill
Description: Are you a meat lover and die for a skirt-steak in the middle of the night after an intense night of partying? Levis Bar and Grill is open 24 hours a day and serves caribbean and local food in abundance. From breakfast to dinner they offer a wide menu for all tastes. Enjoy a refreshing Piña Colada or Daiquiri with eggs or delicious “mofongo” (Mashed Plantain). This is just the best in this place... You can have tasty food and exquisite cocktails at any time. Located in the heart of Isla Verde.

Name: Los Pinos Bar & Restaurant
Description: Los Pinos Cafe became so popular the owners decided to open up a second venue down the street for the crowded days. This restaurant, located in Isla Verde, serves the same Caribbean food at Los Pinos in Santurce, which is one of the locals' favorite place to eat, especially late at night. It's open about 24 hours a day. Breakfast and dinner are served at any time of day. They also serve wine, beer and mixed cocktails.

Name: Vuelta y Vuelta Grill
Description: Their meats and supplements are prepared at the moment with the highest quality products. Their slogan is, "We're not Fast Food. We're a fast restaurant."

Name: Piu Bello
Description: Piu Bello is a gelateria--an Italian ice cream parlor--steps away from the beach. Here you can try some delicious fruit-based sorbets like lemon, guava, and coconut; or you can try their sweeter gelatos such as chocolate, hazelnut, coffee, and choco bariloche (which is a darker, creamier ice cream). Additionally, this diner-like restaurant has an extensive menu that serves mostly American and International diner food. Come to Piu Bello and grab a bite after catching some terrific Isla Verde waves!

Name: La Tetita Lareña
Description: Rich artisan Limber has more than 50 flavors to choose from, including: Strawberry, Nutella, Cheesecake, Strawberry Cheesecake and Strawberry-Mango.

Name: Jendy's Heladeria Artesanal
Description: This artisan ice cream parlor is known for its unique ice cream flavors such as rice with beans, corn, taro, nougat, different tropical fruits, Christmas season flavors, among many more. Vegan ice creams are also available.
Street Address: Praga Street corner Ave Luis Muñoz Marín

Name: Señor Paleta - Condado
Description: In the heart of Condado on Ashford Avenue, our 7th paleteria was opened in 2018. Located just steps away from the ocean, it is the perfect stop for grabbing a refreshing paleta while enjoying a stroll through the hip neighborhood or while sun tanning at the beach. We specialize in creamy and fruity frozen desserts on a stick, made with high quality, natural ingredients. Get to know the JOY of Señor Paleta, we're here to make you smile. Condado location hours: Monday-Sunday 10:30am-11pm

Name: Azúkar y Mas
Description: Azúkar combines several services in one place!! We are a pastry shop, coffee shop, ice cream shop, brunch until 5:00 pm. Azúkar is designed so that you can celebrate your birthday with a delicious cake to go, visit us as a family for Brunch and learn how to prepare pastries or desserts, if we are also a school.

Name: The Meatball Company
Description: This is the place for any meatball lover. The Meatball Company is one of the few places specializing in meatballs in the area. Try their delicious chicken carbonara sauce or the specialty sliders.

Name: Los Chamos Arepas Venezolanas
Description: Los Chamos is a small shack devoted to Venezuelan stuffed arepas a few steps away from the Isla Verde Beach. Here you can try the delicious arepa mixta (which is an arepa stuffed with chicken, beef, and cheese) for just $5 and down it with an ice-cold beer. They also serve cachapas, tequeños and empanadas late at night (and are open 24 hours on weekends), so you're covered if you get those Venezuelan food cravings at 4 AM. Come and take a break at Los Chamos!

Name: Sandra's Point
Description: Sandra's Point is a beachside food stand that sells hamburgers, hot dogs, seafood, turnovers and the best skewers in town! Enjoy the Isla Verde beach with fresh coconut water (or maybe a cold piña colada inside a pineapple) and have some fun in the sun!

Name: Cafetería Loly's
Description: It's 12:00 o'clock and you're looking for a hefty lunch? Destroy your hunger with a heavy plate of rice and beans with a side of grilled chicken at Cafeteria Loly's.

Name: Tuk Tuk
Description: This Food Truck does not have a stationary location, it moves around from restaurant to restaurant so follow them on social media to see what they're up to.

Name: Dr. Bizarro
Description: At Dr. Bizarro you’ll find drinks inspired by popular culture, that is, movies, comics and television series. The Dr. Bizarro food truck is currently located in Miramar Foodtruck Park and our goal is to open new locations soon. In our menu, will surprise you with the many varieties and creations from our laboratory. First, you choose if you want a bubble tea with ice only, with ice and milk, granita: milkshake with water or milkshake: milkshake with milk. Then, you choose the flavor ... And finally, you select the topping of tour liking (like cotton candy!)

Name: Miramar Food Truck Park
Description: Located in the Miramar neighborhood of San Juan, this food truck is an exciting spot to try out a diversity of foods. From dumplings filled with fresh Puerto Rican ingredients to a food truck specializing in roasted meats, the Miramar Food Truck Park is a must-stop when in San Juan.

Name: Smoky Joe Caribbean Grill
Description: This contemporary restaurant located in front of one of the most beautiful beaches of Puerto Rico, has the best cuts of angus meats and seafood in the east region. Smoky Joe Caribbean Grill combines the traditional with the new, offering delicious creative Puerto Rican cuisine with an American BBQ twist. Everything starts with open fires fueled by aromatic cherry & hickory wood and charcoal for slow-smoked cooking. Specialties include smoked ribs, pulled pork, smoked chicken, ribeye cowboy, seafood and more.

Name: El Panino
Description: Don’t let the “food truck” fool you! El Panino is ran by super friendly Chef Carlos Villa. He will whip up something special for you using only the highest quality meats, cheeses and vegetables in unique combinations at any time of the day. This amazing food truck can be described as creative, delicious, distinct and varied – Great for any meal of the day!

Name: El Churry Isla Verde
Description: El Churry is the go-to place for a late night Tripleta, scrumptious chicken or pork sandwich. These subs are a local favorite and perfect after a night out with friends!

Name: Chef Burger
Description: Innovative creativity in homemade hamburgers, offering a variety of flavors with fresh products of the highest quality.

Name: J's Burger
Description: "Specialized in artisanal hamburgers and fillings with a variety of sandwiches, nachos, and natural juices."-J's Burger

Name: Delmaris Quick Lunch
Description: This food truck has delicious Caribbean food with quick and fast service.

Name: La Chancleta de Maíz
Description: La Chancleta de Maíz arrived to change your option at lunchtime. A 100% Boricuan-Style Mexican fusion adjusted to your palate creating our exclusive recipes with hot sauce and pico de gallo varieties.

Name: Platanealo
Description: All the dishes served in Platanealo are made of platano. The moment you arrive at the restaurant, you can see the mountains of Corozal and its surroundings. To place an order or for more information, call: (787) 479-9216.

Name: La Guarapera
Description: All our products will fill you with natural energy. El Guarapo began to take over the island in 2014, when Alex and Glenys, the minds and hearts of this incredible project, decided to bring the flavor of the countryside to the city to the delight of all Boricuas. Coming from a farming family, our founders conceived the idea of a natural, refreshing and delicious product, perfect for the inhabitants of the Island at any time of the day. In addition, this product managed to fulfill a great objective, to transmit and share something of the tradition of the field.

Name: CHRISin Limites
Description: Chris González is the first person with Down Syndrome to own a restaurant in Puerto Rico. CHRISin Limites is located in the Municipality of Rincón.

Name: Arepas Borinquezolanas
Description: This food truck has a fusion of Puerto Rican and Venezuelan dishes.

Name: Rincón del Sabor
Description: This food truck had two locations, one in Vieques and one in Luquillo. They're widely known for their delicious food, from fresh octopus salad to the perfect plate of rice and beans.

Name: Los Amigos Food Truck
Description: We specialize in a Ponce specialty known as "dumplines." Made fresh, you can choose your preferred filling when trying this local staple. Unique and delicious, our "dumplines" are the best in the region. In addition, to our specialty, we also serve sandwiches, burritos, and quesadillas.

Name: La Finca Food Truck
Description: Fresh food, locally sourced from the farms of Puerto Rico. Breakfast and lunch with new specials weekly, always homemade, always farm fresh.- La Finca PR

Name: La Preñá Food Truck
Description: A food truck experience with famous arepas filled with almost anything.

Name: Aguadilla Foodtruck Park
Description: This Food Truck Park in Aguadilla is where you can find a variety of gastronomy selections.

Name: Cool Hope
Description: Cools Hope makes artisan ice cream with the best homemade flavors. They have unique flavors each week including passion fruit and other fruit varieties.

Name: El Tripletón Sandwiches
Description: Visit El Tripletón to experience an authentic Puerto Rican tripleta sandwich. This popular sandwich, as the name suggests, is made of three kinds of meats served in a sweet, buttery bread famously known as "pan sobao."

Name: El Rey del Taco
Description: This is a Food truck in a casual environment, specializing in Mexican flavor... Dare to try something genuine and tasty.

Name: El Vagón
Description: This food truck specializes in artisan burgers, sandwiches with a variety of delicious fillings and nachos. The specialty of the house is the Mofongo Burger.

Name: La Chilanguita Food Truck
Description: A food truck restaurant with a true Mexican experience in San Juan. The dishes are prepared by chef Patricia Rivera.

Name: MIMITACO
Description: Exquisite chicken, meatloaf, fish and vegetarian tacos are prepared with the secret recipe of Chef Mimi who always cooks with LOVE.

Name: Gastropark at 115
Description: Gastropark at 115 is the first indoor food truck park in Puerto Rico.

Name: Tiki's Grill Burgers
Description: After a day of swimming, refuel yourself with a juicy burger from Tiki's and wash it down with an ice-cold beer.

Name: Fresco Aroma
Description: Enjoy a cozy atmosphere with a cup of Puerto Rican coffee. Taste a great variety of Acai Bowls along with an extensive menu of gourmet dishes.

Name: VC Lounge
Description: Warm breezes beckon from VC Lounge’s oceanfront terrace, which offers a captivating setting for relaxing and socializing at any time of day or night. Spacious, grand, yet surprisingly intimate, VC Lounge is the epicenter of the San Juan nightlife scene. Accessible ramp from our hotel lobby to the VC Lounge. Set in exotic, uninterrupted San Juan sea views, guests can lounge comfortably in Marabar, Veritas and Avo cigar Lounge while enjoying appetizers and expertly mixed cocktails. Sunset Happy Hours Join us for daily happy hour from 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm at VC Lounge!

Name: VIVA Casino Bar
Description: ViVa Casino Bar is Ponce's most prestigous venue offering the ultimate in comfort and sophistication. It comes to life at 5PM providing the best quality music and DJ's. With our ultra cool bar, unrivalled light system, strong rotation of resident DJs and live entertainment acts, ViVa Casino Bar is the place where everyone heads to unwind and party.

Name: Hacienda Muñoz
Description: Just half an hour from San Juan, Hacienda Muñoz is a small coffee plantation located in rural San Lorenzo. Take a walking tour of the hacienda where you'll learn about Puerto Rico's coffee history as well as modern methods for grow, processing, and roasting coffee. The tour ends with a tasting of Hacienda Muñoz's specialty coffee. After the tour, stop by their coffee shop or enjoy a hearty, traditional lunch at the hacienda's restaurant.

Name: Hacienda Lealtad
Description: A visit to Hacienda Lealtad, an old coffee estate in Lares, will take you back to the 1800s when coffee was one of the main exports of Puerto Rico. The coffee served is grown in municipalities along the Central Mountain Range and is packed right on the property. It is a medium-dark roast with a smooth texture and full aroma. Pair your coffee with some of their homemade pastries or flans or enjoy a meal with a view at their bistro and restaurant. Make sure to book your tour of the hacienda in advance.

Name: Museo del Café de Puerto Rico
Description: The Museum: When visiting the town of Ciales, let the rich aroma of coffee drag you to Paseo Aroma de Café. Visit Puerto Rico Coffee Museum and learn about the local and regional history of this product as an expression of the general history of the island and the historical development of coffee in the economy of Puerto Rico, which reaffirms our national, cultural and collective character within the historical processes related to Puerto Rican coffee.

Name: Vivo Beach Club
Description: If you wish to spend a luxurious day by a pool in front of the beach, VIVO Beach Club is the place you're looking for. This Isla Verde beach club offers day passes, wonderful membership packages, concerts, scrumptious gastronomic experiences, and many more. VIVO is a great venue for that tropical day at the beach with friends and family, or for a delicious afternoon at one of their restaurants or brewery: they have the renowned Ocean Lab Brewery and the Voodoo Restaurant.

Name: Paseo Tablado de Guaynabo
Description: This urban boardwalk in Guaynabo is lined with small food stands that sell everything from Puerto Rican fritters to tacos, and drinks! During the weekends, the boardwalk is a popular night hangout spot.

Name: Piñones
Description: A picturesque ocean drive from Carolina to Loíza where you can enjoy local dining experiences and practice what Puerto Ricans call chinchorreo. Sample delicious specialties while you hop from food stand to food stand and go back and forth to the beach. Enjoy the peaceful waves at La Pocita or Vacía Talega, two secluded beaches where you can go swimming or soak in the sun.

Name: Río Bayamón Golf Course
Description: The only golf course in Puerto Rico's metro area, the Río Bayamón Golf Course provides a peaceful and relaxed atmosphere and all the amenities. The golf course is an 18-hole complex that includes a clubhouse, putting green, chipping green, and driving range, as well as the convenience of a pro-shop and a restaurant. Driving Range has 58 stations in 2 tiers, 300 yards for your shots, and 75-foot high nets on both sides of the practice area.

Name: Hacienda La Mocha
Description: They are a family-owned sustainable coffee farm and eco-hotel. Also, they are honored to have been named a bird & butterfly sanctuary given the variety of these that live in La Mocha. Visit them and enjoy the grounds as part of one of their informative walking tours or stay and enjoy the full Hacienda La Mocha experience. Tour reservations have to be made in advance and be for 10 people or more.

Name: Potrero y Cafetería Brisas del Mar
Description: Potrero and Cafeteria Brisas del Mar is located in the town of Camuy, between the beautiful view of the sea and the mountains near the coast that makes the area one of a kind. Numerous fauna and flora makes the place wonderful for horseback riding. They have been doing outdoor activities for children and adults for many years: horse rides and excursions, outdoor activities, birthdays, outdoor weddings and private activities. The excursions are accompanied by specialized guides who know the area and it is not necessary to have experience, just wanting to have fun.

Name: Amadeus Bistro
Description: A colorful and fun restaurant close to Plaza las Americas’ shopping center and the San Juan financial district. Serving international cuisine and afternoon musical entertainment shows. It’s an ideal venue for intimate groups such as weddings and meetings.

Name: Café Manolín
Description: A small restaurant in Old san Juan specializing in Puerto Rican food.

Name: Bodegas Compostela Restaurant
Description: Modern restaurant serving its clientele in a warm and elegant environment. The contemporary cuisine, widely recognized and awarded, blends perfectly with a broad selection of wines from its cellar. Impeccable service among local and international guests while doing business or just enjoying the great taste of life.

Name: La Casona Restaurant
Description: La Casona is a Landmark in the ever-changing world of Puerto Rico’s restaurants. Founded in 1971, we have been catering to discerning customers for over 40 years. Our customers love us because we consistently offer the best Spanish-style and International food in a wonderful whimsical setting.

Name: Lupis Mexican Grill & Sports Cantina
Description: Lupis offers a Tex-Mex menu with sports memorabilia. Famous for its "grande" margaritas and thae biggest variety of fajitas in Puerto Rcio. One location in Isla Verde, next to the Wyndham El San Juan Hotel & Casino, the other in Old San Juan. One of the owners is Eduardo Figueroa, ex-pitcher of the yankees, the two-time world series champs.

Name: La Bodega de Méndez - Guaynabo
Description: La Bodega de Méndez has events rooms in its three locations: La Bodega de Méndez in Guaynabo is home to the exclusive Bernard Chappard, La Bodega in Añasco houses the José Luis de Villegas Room, and La Bodega in Ponce also has an event room. Each Room holds a 150, 40 and 200 ppl respectively. All rooms offer a modern kitchen, a projection screen, a projector, and sound system. La Bodega's event rooms are ideal for presentations, meetings, wine tastings, business lunches, and any kind of private event. No corking fee is charged in any event held at La Bodega.

Name: Pelican Dumas Restaurant
Description: San Juan’s only seaside restaurant –watch the sunset and dine on our cozy terrace or sip a drink at our elegant bar. International and local cuisine, fresh seafood –best paella in town! Wine, cheese, tapas and cigar area with musical entertainment. Meeting facilities. Lunch and dinner 7 days a week. Casual attire. Visa/MasterCard and AMEX.

Name: Wendco of Puerto Rico
Description: Fast food restaurant company, operating 20 Wendy’s outlets in Puerto Rico. Co-owners of Sizzler and Longhorn Steakhouse restaurants.

Name: Ruth's Chris Steak House
Description: At Ruth's Chris Steak House we take steak seriously, but we're also serious about making any meeting or event memorable and assure you that you will have the world's best steak. Let your guest be pampered by the hospitable staff and enjoy the umparalelled menu. Make it Ruth's Chris for your next meeting, party or family gathering. Private Dining Available.

Name: Señor Frog's Restaurant
Description: We are a world wide known restaurant, with more than 60 years in the industry, dedicated to selling great food in a party ambience. Some of the extras we provide are a Boutique (clothing store), Bar time, life music and a happy staff. Entertainment and food are our main priorities.

Name: Xaufra Latina Bistro/Restaurant Corp.
Description: Catering & Restaurant Corp. We specialize in Puerto Rican & International Cuisine. Our restaurants opens for lunch & dinner from Tuesday to Sunday. The catering can cater any type activity from 15 or more. Hope to hear from you soon!

Name: El Patio de Sam
Description: For over 50 years El Patio de Sam is recognized for its great tasting frappes, burgers and sandwiches. We offer a varied menu for lunch or dinner, characterized by our service.

Name: Tamarind Steak Corporation
Description: Puerto Rico's premier Latino steakhouse featuring a seafood-ceviche bar. Trendy martinis created by a beautiful bartender in a contemporary Old San Juan setting.

Name: Bistro de Paris
Description: French Cuisine Hours of operation: Monday, Tuesday & Wednesday from 11:30pm - 10:00pm Thursday from 11:30pm - 11:00pm Friday from 11:30 am - 12:00 am midnight Saturday from 11:00 am -12:00am- midnight Sunday from 11:00 am - 10:00 pm Price Range: $15.00 -$37.00 90 pp capacity-Plaza de Diego Building

Name: Puerto Rico's Café Cola'o
Description: Puerto Rico's Café Colao is a place where the occasional and the regular coffee drinkers can taste many grains of the special coffee from Puerto Rico. In our boutique atmosphere locale, our visitors will have the opportunity to learn the history, savor and buy the coffee of their choice.

Name: El Cielito
Description: Located in the mountains. This restaurant offers execlent food in a relaxed environment. Enjoy the panoramic view of Cayey. Meeting and Banquet facilities are availbale for your event.

Name: Caña
Description: Discover the inspired cuisine that put the Island of Enchantment on the map, seamlessly blended with authentic Puerto Rican flavors. Each one-of-a-kind dish invites guests to celebrate San Juan’s traditions old and new, with international zest and fresh ingredients. Enjoy breakfast, lunch, cocktails, and dinner daily at our indoor space or at the covered terrace overlooking the Well & Being pool.

Name: Food Net Puerto Rico
Description: Multi- restaurant service with over 85 member restaurants. We provide food delivery to your home, office or event location. We also offer a multi-restaurant gift card and provide the most complete online restaurant directory in Puerto Rico at www.foodnetpr.com . Deliveries in about 55 minutes from placed order or orders in advanced online or by phone. We accept VISA, MC and AMEX.

Name: St. Germain Bistro & Cafe
Description: St. Germain is a unique experience in Old San Juan; it’s located in a beautiful colonial building with an outdoor café feel. Their dishes consist of gourmet sandwiches, freshly baked quiche, ceviche, abundant salads and creative pizzas. The breeze, music, and ambiance will force you to appreciate your surroundings, and after leaving, you will long to relive the experience. 40-50 pp capacity

Name: Richie's Café
Description: Richie's has been resident of Palmer, Puerto Rico for twenty four years. His property, now home to Richie's Café, has one of natures most breathtaking views. Richie's Café is set high a top mountain overlooking the greens of the Rio Mar Wyndham Grand Resort golf course straight out to the crystal clear Atlantic Ocean with a side view of the United States only national rain forest, El Yunque. So began the dream of Richie's Café, two open air dining rooms each with a bar, serving Caribbean cuisine while overlooking the mountain view of the Atlantic Ocean.

Name: Ristorante Casa Italia
Description: A taste of Italy in Hato Rey, Ristorante Casa Italia by Chef Alberto Gianati is a truly great, culinary experience, in an elegant and serene atmosphere. Perfect for business lunch or a candlelit romantic dinner. Private seating available for groups or meetings.

Name: Vaca Brava - Old San Juan
Description: Original Puerto Rican cuisine in a comfortable setting that suites everybody's taste. First class service and original taste makes this location a must for Puerto Rican cuisine loving people.

Name: Marisquería Atlántica Puerta de Tierra
Description: Spanish tavern restaurant specializes in fresh seafood menu offerings. We prepare paella, soups, salads and our daily Chef specials. Our venue has the capacity for activities and special meetings for a maximum of 127 people. We offer excellent service in a relaxing environment. The dishes are prepared with fresh and natural ingredients for your enjoyment. Private room-25pp Main Room-118pp

Name: Rest El Dajao
Description: no info

Name: Picadera Del Coquí
Description: This location offers a great selection of: Costillas BBQ, Frituras, Empanadillas de Mariscos, Carne Frita, Caldo 7 Potencias, Bebidas, Cuajos, Papas Asadas ¡Y MUCHO MAS!

Name: Rincón Beer Company
Description: Rincón Beer Company is a microbrewery located in downtown Rincón, Puerto Rico, open under new management since November 24th, 2018. We have 16 taps of mostly local micro-brewery products. We also offer a cocktail menu, of which most ingredients are made in our establishment. We are known for our great service, the quality of our products, and a beach town atmosphere like we’re used to in the western part of the Island.

Name: Aquamarina
Description: Further south in the town of Lajas, in the hotel Villa Parguera, Aquamarina Restaurant offers a menu specialized in seafood and authentic dishes.

Name: Seagrapes Restaurant - St. Regis Bahía Beach Hotel
Description: Seagrapes’ contemporary design and casual al fresco dining area all in an enchanted setting of The St. Regis Bahia Beach pool esplanade which offers dramatic scenes of the Atlantic Ocean.

Name: Dragon Chino - Cayey
Description: tel desconectadono info

Name: El Gran Café - Aguadilla
Description: Recorded Closed: 11/2/2018

Name: La Piccola Fontana - Carolina
Description: Recorded closed on Google - 11/28/2018

Name: Kioskos De Luquillo
Description: The Luquillo Kiosks are comprised of a row of around 60 family-owned kiosks selling food, drinks, and souvenirs. Visitors to the kiosks will find that they vary in style, taste, and price. They're all open air, and while some face the street, others have beautiful views of the beach. This is a perfect pitstop after enjoying a beach day on the east coast or a hiking day at El Yunque.

Name: Los Cidrines
Description: Being one the biggest bakery’s suppliers in Puerto Rico, you are sure to have some of the best "Criollo" sandwiches in the island. The Cidrines is known for the quality of their bread, and pretty much everything else they bake.

Name: Believe Bar & Grill
Description: Our menu specializes in Caribbean food. We also have a Brunch menu, plus you can enjoy stand up comedy every other Friday Night as well as Karaoke.
Street Address: Urb. Ponce de León Ave. Esmeralda P-10

Name: Pelican Beachfront Grill at Rincón Beach Resort
Description: The Pelican Beachfront Grill offers a convenient and delightful dining experience just steps from the beach and poolside of Rincón Beach Resort. Indulge in an array of enticing options, including creative cocktails, appetizers, grilled sandwiches, and burgers. Whether you're lounging by the pool or enjoying the stunning beach views, the Pelican Beachfront Grill at Rincón Beach Resort provides a relaxed atmosphere where you can savor delicious food and refreshing cocktails.

Name: Santurce's Café
Description: Santurce's Cafe is located in the heart of La Placita. The bar has a casual and friendly ambiance for a day drink and great local atmosphere at night.

Name: Flor de Parcha
Description: In an old house of Río Piedras, Flor de Parcha bets for a gourmet approach to Puerto Rican food and a hint of natural fruits flavors. As soon as you walk into this restaurant, the smell of a fresh cooked meal, fresh fruits and ingredients will make you want to ask for everything in the menu. If confused, go for the majado de viandas. You won’t regret it. This place also offers an outside bar, where wine and sangrias are served in a relaxed ambient for people to get to know each other. Flor de Parcha is a restaurant that makes you fall in love with the best of Puerto Rican cuisine.

Name: La Mala Vida
Description: Famously known for their brunches, La Mala Vida is the perfect fusion of Caribbean and Mexican delights. They also serve delicious mimosas in different flavors in including coconut, and tamarind.

Name: Pasta To Go
Description: Recorded closed on Google - 11/28/2018

Name: Panadería La Vega
Description: Recorded closed - 11/21/2018

Name: Brazo Gitano Franco
Description: NO INFO

Name: La Greca
Description: Feel like dancing salsa with Puerto Rican experts and college students? La Greca is definitely the spot you have to visit. This second-floor salsa club is one of the best places for you to learn how to move your feet and hips to the rhythm of the biggest hits of Puerto Rican salsa. Once in a while, you may listen to some reggaetón, merengue or bachata that will just keep people dancing. The sweat and the rhythm will make your night an unforgettable one.

Name: Los Hijos de Alto del Cabro
Description: This cafe serves exquisite Puerto Rican food. They specialize in Caribbean cuisine, so you can try many local favorites while enjoying the lively music.

Name: El Borikén
Description: The small business of El Borikén reflects the evolution of Puerto Rican culture. In this place, during the day, you will be able to eat a great Puerto Rican lunch at college student prices. But, during the night, bring your dancing shoes and the energy to dance. This spot is famous for the reggaetón, but that is not all. Musical groups of bomba and plena gather to play during special occasions and people dance to that cultural beat.

Name: Libras Steakhouse & Seafood - Carolina
Description: Recorded Closed: 5/30/2018

Name: Antique Coffee Shop & More
Description: This is a coffee shop that offers a familiar and peaceful atmosphere where you can relax and enjoy good service.

Name: El Caracol - Cabo Rojo
Description: no info

Name: Puerto Rico Bagel Co.
Description: Puerto Rico's only hand made New York style bagel. Home to the Pernilicious, artisanal Lox, other deli-style meats and veggie options. Come join us for breakfast, brunch, lunch, or your catered event.

Name: El Criollito - Caguas
Description: Telefono fuera de servicio / 25 de junio de 2018

Name: Borikuas Bistro & Bar
Description: At Borikuas Bistro & Bar the food lovers will initiate their experience with a variety of starters that include chicken wings, cod and cassava croquettes, fried cheese, morcilla patty, among others. Each day we prepare the Creame of the day and a variety of main course menu that includes our organic and boneless ChuleKan(Kan Kan pork chop). Our menu is prepared on the restaurant everyday. The Brunch Despierta Borikua is available all day, everyday.

Name: T.Tuan Old San Juan
Description: T•tuan Old San Juan is a timeless bar and cocktail restaurant overlooking the San Juan Bay serving creative tapas and a wide selection of cocktails and wines. Outdoor cafe, Spanish patio, bar, and main dining room. Proud to be a gay-friendly place. Pets are allowed.

Name: Musas & Eventos Café Concert
Description: Musas y Eventos, independent theater and tapas restaurant. Unique environment for anyone who wants to enjoy the world of the arts, drama and music. Tapas and boutique wines along with the exclusive Puerto Rican coffee. Our menu includes homemade traditional Spanish tapas and a fusion with Puerto Rican and world variety of tapas. A selected palate for everyone. Follow us on Facebook and Instagram (Musasyeventos/Musasyeventospr).

Name: Numero Uno Beach Bar + Kitchen
Description: Numero Uno Beach Bar + Kitchen offers simple favorites with a local twist. Enjoy breakfast or lunch in our newly renovated bar and kitchen or sit outdoors with your toes in the sand at one of our beach tables. Try freshly prepared favorites from made to order omelets and banana waffles to brisket burgers and tempura style mahi tacos while taking in the sites and relaxing sounds of Ocean Park Beach. Cool off with a selection of local beers from Ocean Lab Brewing Co. try a signature cocktail like the spicy margarita, or pair your food with a wide variety of red, white, and sparkling wines.

Name: Parador El Buen Café
Description: Located in Hatillo, Parador El Buen Café is in the city center. Arecibo Observatory and Arecibo Lighthouse are local landmarks, and the area's natural beauty can be seen at Rio Camuy Cave Park and Caño Tiburones Nature Reserve, minutes away from the Estatua de Cristobal Colón. Along with a restaurant, this smoke-free hotel has an outdoor pool and a business center. Free WiFi in public areas and free self-parking are also provided. Additionally, there's a conference space, a 24-hour front desk, and multilingual staff are onsite.

Name: Almaviva Restaurant
Description: Almaviva's innovative menu concept is a fusion of techniques that draws inspiration from the culinary traditions of Latin-Caribbean, Asian, and French cuisine— without losing the original essence of each region. Each dish is prepared with an emphasis on simplicity, letting the fresh local ingredients shine through. Chef Juan Peña's passion for cooking has always been a constant in his life, starting with his grandmother's stews and his father's garden. His technique was mastered under the masters Boulud and Vongerichten.

Name: Franchella Ice Cream Co.
Description: Orocovis now has its first artisan ice cream shop. Located next to the plaza in downtown Orocovis, Franchella offers freshly made ice cream and popsicles. Using their own recipes and creative combinations this cozy location is already attracting visitors from all towns, as well as tourists from other countries. They have a nice balance, from lactose-free options like their unique coconut flavor to unusual ones like one of their best sellers, Honey and Ginger. Some are even made with local fruits like their Passion Fruit sorbet, made with fruit from the mountains of Orocovis.

Name: Vianda
Description: Located in the San Juan neighborhood of Santurce, Vianda serves a small, seasonal, rotating menu anchored by local ingredients and products. This enables us to create, fresh, delicious food and drinks focusing on the best that Puerto Rico has to offer. With an emphasis on hospitality, we strive to provide a warm environment for our guests where one feels comfortable and taken care of. Our well rounded, slightly eclectic wine list focuses on providing delicious wines that pair well with our constantly evolving menu.

Name: Señor Paleta - Ponce
Description: Now with seven locations in Puerto Rico and one in Central Florida, our artisanal ice pops are filled with joy and fun flavors for those who believe in the world. We specialize in creamy and fruity frozen desserts on a stick, made with high quality, natural ingredients. Get to know the JOY of Señor Paleta, we're here to make you smile. Ponce location hours: Monday-Saturday 9:00am-9:00pm Sunday 11:00am-7:00pm

Name: Señor Paleta - Paseo Caribe
Description: Right at the entrance to Old San Juan, our 3rd paletería is located on Paseo Caribe, right next to the Hilton hotel. We specialize in creamy and fruity frozen desserts on a stick, made with high quality, natural ingredients. Get to know the JOY of Señor Paleta, we're here to make you smile. El Mercado de Paseo Caribe location hours: Sunday-Wednesday 11:00am-9:00pm Thursday-Saturday 11:00am-11:00pm

Name: Señor Paleta - Bayamón
Description: You can find our 5th paletería at the food court in the Plaza del Sol shopping center. Take a break from your shopping and refresh yourself with a delicious paleta. We specialize in creamy and fruity frozen desserts on a stick, made with high quality, natural ingredients. Get to know the JOY of Señor Paleta, we're here to make you smile. Plaza del Sol-Bayamón, location hours: Monday-Saturday 11:00am-9:00pm Sunday 11:00am-7pm

Name: Señor Paleta - Carolina
Description: Located in the Plaza Carolina shopping center, our 6th paletería covers the eastern metropolitan area and offers all of our delicious flavors. We specialize in creamy and fruity frozen desserts on a stick, made with high quality, natural ingredients. Get to know the JOY of Señor Paleta, we're here to make you smile! Plaza Carolina location hours: Monday-Saturday 11:00am-9:00pm Sunday 11:00am-6:00pm

Name: Jungle Bird
Description: Amid the bustle of iconic La Placita de Santurce lies Jungle Bird, a hot leisure cocktail bar offering the best of the island experience. Serving not tiki, but Taino-tropical drinks combined with a surprising and ever-changing food menu to write home about --this jungle embodies the joy and relaxation of the Caribbean.

Name: Surf Caffé
Description: The perfect oceanside spot in Condado, Puerto Rico to enjoy quality cocktails, fresh appetizers and specialty coffee in good company.

Name: El Local 00765
Description: El Local was founded by three friends in the wake of Hurricane Maria. Representing the best in local Puerto Rican and Viequense cuisine to celebrate the moderno Latino culinary movement. We welcome our guests to celebrate with us in a revitalized patio in the heart of Isabella II.

Name: Café Don Ruiz
Description: Located inside the Cuartel de Ballajá, a building that centuries ago served as barracks for Spanish soldiers, Café Don Ruiz has a long family tradition of coffee roasting. Enjoy a single harvest, hand-picked medium-dark roast specialty gourmet coffee from the mountains of Yauco. The roast is similar to espresso, bringing out all the complex flavors of the Arabica beans without burning off its fragrances.

Name: Café Con Cé
Description: A minimalist coffee shop hidden in busy Calle Loíza features 100% Puerto Rican coffee from the mountains of Jayuya. This is the perfect hideaway for coffee enthusiasts that love simplicity and a calm environment. Their caffeinated drinks are best accompanied by their tasty homemade pastries like quesitos, banana bread, and their famous baklava.

Name: Barra de Quesos
Description: Barra de Quesos (Cheese Bar) is a new concept of gastronomy in Puerto Rico: a Tapas Bar and a Cheese Shop in the same place. Those passionate about cheese found Cheesy-land! Let the Cheese Lady, Rosa/Lila Avalo, guide you to the best mouth-watering cheese and enjoy them with their perfect wine and beer pairing. The menu includes fondue and traditional raclette for an unforgettable experience.

Name: Wilo Eatery & Bar
Description: The new Wilo Benet culinary experience is here and it's cooking! After 28 years of running Pikayo, get ready for the evolution of our great flavors and services at our new location, Wilo Eatery & Bar! Sit down and dine in with us for lunch, dinner or Sunday brunch, enjoy our fast-casual lunch and breakfast service, Myxta or you can take us to the comfort of your home with our To-go food service area, Payevar. At Wilo Eatery and Bar, everything is a possibility!

Name: Semilla Kitchen & Bar
Description: Located in the heart of Condado, Semilla Kitchen & Bar serves fresh and flavorful food infused with vibrant roots of Puerto Rican Cuisine. Open for breakfast/brunch, lunch & dinner.

Name: Cayo Caribe - Old San Juan
Description: Cayo Caribe serves one of the best Caribbean food and seafood in the area. The best part is its modest prices and extensive offering. You can choose to enjoy your food in the outdoor patio or, in the indoor venue. -Hours: 11 a.m. - 9:30 p.m.

Name: Cayo Caribe - Hato Rey
Description: Cayo Caribe serves one of the best Caribbean food and seafood in the area. The best part is its modest prices and extensive offering. You can choose to enjoy your food in the outdoor patio or, in the indoor venue. -Hours: 11 a.m. - 9:30 p.m.

Description: Cayo Caribe serves one of the best Caribbean food and seafood in the area. The best part is its modest prices and extensive offering. You can choose to enjoy your food in the outdoor patio or, in the indoor venue. -Hours: 11 a.m. - 9:30 p.m.

Name: Majados
Description: You'll find Majados, a creative food truck specializing in criollo cuisine, in the eastern town of Luquillo. Our creative dishes are all centered around majados de viadas (mashed root vegetables)— ranging from malanga to yuca. Once you've chosen your base, it's time to decide between chicken, pork chops, steak, skirt steak, shrimps, or any combination you wish to make. Then top it all of with more flavorful toppings like cheese, sour cream, pico de gallo, or salad. We also have mamposteao rice, ceviche, and plantain nachos.

Name: Nacho Libre Cantina Mexicana - Lote 23
Description: At Nacho Libre Mexican Cantina, we believe in giving people the freedom to choose. We are a company created by two young Puerto Rican entrepreneurs offering exquisite dishes inspired by the tradition of Mexican street cuisine. We pride ourselves in using only fresh ingredients and products to prepare recipes to the taste of each diner. What’s more, we provide a colorful and vibrant environment that creates a memorable culinary experience and makes our patrons want to return for more. At Nacho Libre, you choose it your way. #vivelibre

Name: STK San Juan
Description: STK is a unique concept that artfully blends the modern steakhouse and a chic lounge into one, offering a dynamic, fine dining experience with the superior quality of a traditional steakhouse. STK distinguishes itself by emphasizing the social experience and taking a vibe-driven approach to fine dining. Every venue has a DJ to create an infectious, high-energy atmosphere and the sleek environment is designed to encourage guests to interact and mingle. Ultimately, STK aims to define the modern dining experience complete with incredible food, world-class service, and the perfect ambiance.

Name: Atabey Condado
Description: Located near the beach in Condado, Atabey is a Caribbean/American New Fare Restaurant. We use locally sourced ingredients and are very proud to serve 100% PR grown coffee. Trust us the best in the world! Vegetarian options are always available. Pet-friendly as well.

Name: El Rastro
Description: El Rastro is a space where culinary creativity is let loose with the simple aim of sharing with our patrons the culinary experiences that we've had during our travels around the world. Our mission is to bring the flavors of all these countries to all of our dishes, taking our patrons on a journey through our memories. At El Rastro, it's all about the details, which is why our restaurant also doubles as an exhibition space for local artists. So, when you visit our restaurant, not only will you be joining us on our travels, but you'll also be surrounded by local art.

Name: A Fuego Bar & Restaurant
Description: A Fuego Bar & Restaurant is defined as an aromatic mix of herbs and spices, used as a base flavoring and seasoning to the Puerto Rican cuisine. The mix includes the authentic Puerto Rican food, magnificent sounds of music from around the world and the Caribbean atmosphere with delightful firefighter room decor and fantastic service. As a final touch, we will take any heat off the table with the Colombian national dish “Bandeja Paisa”, live lobster, and Great Pernil.

Name: La Bodega de Méndez - Ponce
Description: La Bodega de Méndez has events rooms in its three locations: La Bodega de Méndez in Guaynabo is home to the exclusive Bernard Chappard, La Bodega in Añasco houses the José Luis de Villegas Room, and La Bodega in Ponce also has an event room. Each Room holds a 150, 40 and 200 ppl respectively. All rooms offer a modern kitchen, a projection screen, a projector, and sound system. La Bodega's event rooms are ideal for presentations, meetings, wine tastings, business lunches, and any kind of private event. No corking fee is charged in any event held at La Bodega.

Description: The story of El Meson Sandwiches began in 1972 on our first store in Aguadilla. Today we already have 36 stores around the island and growing with an expansion to the United States. We are the first fast-food chain native Puerto Rican, which fills us with pride and that drives continue to raise the standards of product quality and service to you, our guest. Since our inception, El Meson Sandwiches has been a family-owned business; now with a much larger family of waiters and waitresses about 1,300 who daily strive to provide the best and freshest product.
